description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8jsod","text":"This protocol outlines a step-by-step guide to generating single-cell suspensions of Drosophila melanogaster pupal tarsi for use in 10x single-cell transcriptome profiling. This protocol has been successfully used on male legs between 16h and 30h after puparium formation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":85,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4oquj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6s5t0","text":"From an input of 65-70 first tarsal segments, we typically generate a suspension with the following metrics:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9lv1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"el20o","text":"Expected volume of suspension generated: ~65ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e003n","text":"Expected cell concentration of suspension generated: ~1000-2000 cells/ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ur2l","text":"Expected cell viability of suspension generated: ~98%","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

journals.name: PLOS Biology
journals.citation: Hopkins BR, Barmina O, Kopp A (2023) A single-cell atlas of the sexually dimorphic Drosophila foreleg and its sensory organs during development. PLoS Biol 21(6): e3002148. doi: 10.1371/journal.pbio.3002148

keywords: single-cell; tissue dissociation; scRNA-seq; Drosophila; tarsus; tarsi; pupa; pupal dissection; puparium; leg development; sensory organ; cuticle-associated cells
manuscript_citation: Hopkins BR, Barmina O, Kopp A (2023) A single-cell atlas of the sexually dimorphic Drosophila foreleg and its sensory organs during development. PLoS Biol 21(6): e3002148. doi: 10.1371/journal.pbio.3002148
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"bmnr9","text":"1. S. P. Bainbridge, M. Bownes, Staging the metamorphosis of Drosophila melanogaster. Development. 66, 57–80 (1981).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":116}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qm6t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tt94","text":"2. J. T. O’Connor, E. K. Shannon, M. S. Hutson, A. Page-McCaw, Mounting Drosophila pupae for laser ablation and live imaging of the dorsal thorax. STAR Protoc. 3 (2022).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":169}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lnuh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l1al","text":"3. O. E. Psathaki, A. Paululat, Preparation of Drosophila Tissues and Organs for Transmission Electron Microscopy. Methods Mol. Biol. 2540, 361–385 (2022).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":155}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5t5ki","text":"Collect white prepupae. Individuals should meet the P1 aging criteria laid out by Bainbridge and Bownes (1981): the pupae should be white or cream coloured, have stopped moving completely, and display everted anterior spiracles. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qq9c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a1uci","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ov2j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"af17o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anq00","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2pi42","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":14,"style":"italic"},{"length":2,"offset":64,"style":"italic"}],"key":"e78jk","text":"Collect pupae n -1 hours before starting pupal de-casing, where n is the desired developmental timepoint for sequencing. Pupae are removed from the pupal case 1 hour before the leg dissection, hence the '-1'.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":79,"offset":127}],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":103,"style":"italic"}],"key":"726h9","text":"Helpful, high-quality images of pupae at the correct stage can be found in Chyb and Gompel's 'Atlas of Drosophila morphology' (https://www.sciencedirect.com/book/9780123846884/atlas-of-drosophila-morphology).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"A05C8700B4A611ED86430A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.sciencedirect.com/book/9780123846884/atlas-of-drosophila-morphology"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d67nj","text":"We aim to dissect 65-70 legs for a single-cell suspension. Collecting 40-50 pupae provides a buffer that allows for some failed dissections.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3voch","text":"Fold a kimwipe in half and then in half again a further two times. Place inside a Petri dish and wet the kimwipe with   of water. Then transfer the pupae from the glass well to the kimwipe using a paintbrush. Cover the Petri dish and move to an incubator set to  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":118,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":262,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2meaf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fuq82","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btom8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"81AAE740B4A811ED877F9BCD6951C57C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"77C9C250B4A811ED877F9BCD6951C57C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"25","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":220}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b544n","text":"We have found that this volume of water is optimal. Too much and the pupal case softens and is hard to cut; too little and pupal development appears to be compromised. Beyond 30h dissections (36h and 40h), we have found   to be optimal.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3nj2p","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"750","error":false,"guid":"D57E19F0B4A811ED877F9BCD6951C57C","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gl9t","text":"Identify individuals of the correct sex. Place white prepupae in a glass well with water under a dissection microscope. At this developmental stage the male gonads are visible on either side of the posterior ~1/3rd of the pupae.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2r9hr","text":"At n - 1 hours, remove the Petri dish from the incubator. Using a wet paintbrush, gently remove the pupae from the by now dry kimwipe. Wetting the paintbrush helps to loosen the pupae from the wipe. Transfer the pupae to a dry kimwipe and gently pat them down to further dry them. Then transfer dorsal side up to a piece of sticky tape (sticky side up) that is secured to a flat surface (e.g. a piece of plastic or microscope slide).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":3,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":388,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce1qk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7la3v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r3e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a5rq1","text":"Transfer multiple pupae at a time to give them an opportunity to continue to dry while on the tape. This makes for easier de-casing.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3q735","text":"Using forceps, gently remove the pupal casing. Begin by removing the operculum and then cut laterally down the side of the case, working from anterior to posterior and gently peeling away the cut casing to expose the pupa. Then transfer the de-cased pupa to a kimwipe soaked through with water in a Petri dish.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43u0g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bdtr8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5eahu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b9mir","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":7,"offset":9,"style":"italic"}],"key":"j9m9","text":"O'Connor et al. (2022) and Psathaki and Paulula (2022) both give helpful visual guides to performing this procedure.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4oodv","text":"Line pupae dorsal-side down (to avoid water-logging the legs) on the kimwipe in the order in which they were de-cased.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"18qrg","text":"Add   of Dulbecco's PBS (DPBS) to a glass well on ice under a dissection scope.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dleii","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8r52d","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d34n9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"84DA1390B61B11EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":347393,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Dulbecco’s Phosphate Buffered Saline","linfor":"","url":"https://www.sigmaaldrich.com/catalog/product/sigma/d8537?lang=en\u0026region=US","sku":"D8537","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"D3360B20B61B11EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","entries":null,"vendor":{"id":17,"name":"Merck MilliporeSigma (Sigma-Aldrich)","link":"http://sigmaaldrich.com","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83soc","text":"Use forceps to transfer several pupae, starting with the first that were de-cased, to the same tape-covered surface used for the de-casing. Place pupae ventral side up (i.e. legs facing up). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":169,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ai291","text":"For each pupa, begin by pinching the  base of the abdomen to release fluid. This prevents the release of large amounts of fluid while pinching the leg, which interferes with the dissection. Gently press on the head to push fluid out.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"djs1u","text":"To dissect forelegs, pull the second and third legs away from the body such that they point ~90° away from the body. This exposes the foreleg tarsus. The tibia/tarsus joint should be visible approximately in line with or just below the developing mouthparts.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vuld","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hl5m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"op07","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"arrdr","text":"The tibia/tarsus joint in the second leg can be exposed by pulling away the third leg following the same approach above. The joint is a little more proximal with respect to the mouthparts and falls approximately in line with the position of the first/second tarsal joint in the foreleg. The third leg tibia/tarsus joint is a little more proximal again.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"co1kb","text":"Using forceps, pinch at the joint and pull away from the body of the pupa. The tarsus should come away.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1o96h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4j1om","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d900j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"972gg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jrb5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"45jfg","text":"At 16h after puparium formation, the actual tibia/tarsus joint seems to sit a little more proximally than the joint-like indentation that's visible in the cuticle. At this timepoint, the pinch should be made a little higher up to account for this. The pinch will need to be made more proximally if targeting tibia at any timepoint.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fbc4m","text":"If targeting the lower tarsal segments or pretarsus, it is still easiest to make the pinch at the tibia/tarsus joint but adjust the position of the slice in step 12.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f8eqc","text":"Place the tarsus down on the tape and cover with    of DPBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"26q7j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"E8DEE7F0B61E11EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2siin","text":"Using a Micro Knife, slice at approximately the midsection of the tarsal segment adjacent to the segments that are being targeted i.e., if targeting the first tarsal segment slice at the midsection of the second tarsal segment. A slice can be made on both the proximal and distal side of the targeted region to isolate a subset of segments. After making the slice(s), use forceps to gently ease the targeted region out from the pupal cuticle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":130,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85j9t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1i1rq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9p156","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7rb1u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"brand":"Fine Science Tools","can_edit":1,"file":{"icon":"","id":null,"name":"","source":""},"guid":"662DBEA0BDCE11EDA8D4BD652D45ADCD","id":3845,"image":{"icon":"","id":null,"name":"","source":""},"link":"https://www.finescience.com/en-US/Products/Scalpels-Blades/Micro-Knives/Micro-Knives-Plastic-Handle/10318-14","name":"Micro Knives - Plastic Handle","sku":"10318-14","specifications":"","type":"Ultra-thin dissecting blade","vendor":{"id":83,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"http://www.finescience.com/","name":"Fine Science Tools"}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6j4l3","text":"Generally, the definition of the different tarsal segments is improved at later timepoints. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"519E6590B61F11EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3kh3g","text":"Using a freshly BSA-coated 10ul tip, pipette the first tarsal segment and transfer to the well of DPBS on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1t20r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"51nnp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"26j5a","text":"BSA-coat a tip by pipetting up and down a solution of 1% BSA in DPBS 10 times.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"81u4d","text":"Repeat until the well contains 65-70 dissected tarsal segments. Two trained personnel working simultaneously can generally complete this within   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":144,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eospb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":5400,"guid":"80051CD0B62411EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cp8vi","text":"Using a 10ul tip, remove all of the DPBS from the well. Avoid removing dissected tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7g57m","text":"Add   of dissociation buffer, which consists of 10x TrypLE with a final concentration of   collagenase.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":89,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"beb3p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"241ds","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fpclo","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"16q2e","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dsvms","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vlh4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"8ABBDE10B62011EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"2","error_concentration":false,"guid":"D2DFBB80B62011EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":204}},"2":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"C5BA19F0B62011EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":240089,"linfor":null,"mol_weight":0,"name":"TrypLE\u0026trade; Select Enzyme (10X), no phenol red","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"A1217701","stats":{"total_protocols":1},"url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/A1217701","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/440.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.thermofisher.com","name":"Thermo Fisher"}}},"3":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":1,"cas_number":"9001-12-1","guid":"5E1F02A0B62111EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":958368,"linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Collagenase","public":0,"rrid":"","sku":"C0130","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"https://www.sigmaaldrich.com/US/en/product/sigma/c0130","vendor":{"id":17,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"http://sigmaaldrich.com","name":"Merck MilliporeSigma (Sigma-Aldrich)"}}},"4":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":63}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2qdm1","text":"The buffer can be premade and stored in individual aliquots at  .","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"13qlq","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F52D8DA0B62211EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

Scientific","link":"https://www.thermofisher.com/us/en/home.html","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}},"file":null,"image":null}},"3":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":3846,"brand":"Nunc","can_edit":0,"guid":"027782A0BDCF11EDA8D4BD652D45ADCD","link":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/232698","name":"Auminum Scientific","link":"https://www.lifetechnologies.com","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}},"file":null,"image":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bascg","text":"Remove from the bead bath and then remove ~  of dissociation buffer using a 10ul tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dr8ut","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"374jo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rs9u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"85","error":false,"guid":"EA0C6410B62111EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cc1du","text":"The buffer removal is a balancing act. In theory, leaving too much buffer could interfere with the reagents used during 10x library preparation. However, after removing the first ~60ul it can be hard to remove more without losing tissue. Take this step slowly and move the tip to different regions of the well to avoid losing or disrupting the tissue.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2tgjl","text":"Add   of room temperature DPBS to the well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ptk0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"78698D00B62211EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dsjqj","text":"Pipette the solution up and down 20x using a widebore, BSA-coated, lowbind tip. Aim for ~1.5 pipettes up and down per second, moving the tip around in the well to ensure an even dissociation throughout the suspension. Avoid introducing bubbles into the suspension. Use a 200ul pipette set to 40ul.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4tne","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fnfj7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ja6m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c88ad","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"brand":"ART","can_edit":1,"file":{"icon":"","id":null,"name":"","source":""},"guid":null,"id":3833,"image":{"icon":"","id":null,"name":"","source":""},"link":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/2069G","name":"ART 200ul Wide Bore Filtered Pipette Tips","sku":"2069G","specifications":"","type":"Pipette tips","vendor":{"id":95,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.thermofisher.com/us/en/home.html","name":"Thermo Fisher Scientific"}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3f21k","text":"BSA-coat the tip as in step 13.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"8652B030B62311EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ufcm","text":"Pipette the solution up and down a further 20x using a BSA-coated, flame-rounded 200ul tip. Again, make sure to move the tip around in the well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bc6dt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f8abv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1f7rf","text":"Prepare tips ahead of time by quickly passing them near a flame. Check under a microscope that the tip walls at the end are not rough but smooth and slightly rounded.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ajv3","text":"Slowly pipette the solution up and down a further three times using the same flame-rounded tip before taking up   and transferring to a 2mL low-bind Eppendorf tube on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":112,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"be3a9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"0AEB8B00B62411EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"daf73","text":"Add a further   of DPBS to the well, pipette up and down three times using the flame-rounded tip, and add    to the same Eppendorf on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":106,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"igqn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"26F212B0B62411EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"953B64E0B62B11EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"epq4m","text":"Preview   of suspensions using a hemocytometer or automated cell counter. Concentrations and singlet rates should be checked against the requirements of the single-cell technology being used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"41kal","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"44D8CC10B62411EDA6D62D9CF8E8D6F5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
